summary:
Welcoming efforts to update the National Drug Control Strategy, 

Expressing concern over the consequences of violent and terrorist activities on the Afghan Government's capacity, 

Reiterating support for Afghan Government efforts, with international community assistance, to improve security and address extremist threats.
Condemning in strongest terms attacks targeting civilians and Afghan and international forces, 
Welcoming Afghan Government's achievements in banning ammonium nitrate fertilizer, 
Recognizing increased threats from Taliban, Al-Qaida and extremist groups, 
Expressing serious concern over high civilian casualties, particularly among women and children, 
Taking note of progress made by ISAF in minimizing civilian casualties, 
Expressing strong concern over recruitment and use of children by Taliban forces, 
Acknowledging progress in security sector reform, 
Stressing importance of further progress in ending impunity, strengthening judicial institutions, 
Reiterating call on Afghan parties to engage in peaceful political dialogue, 
Noting leading role of Afghan Independent Election Commission in 2010 parliamentary elections, 
Recognizing importance of regional partners' contribution to Afghanistan's stabilization, 
Welcoming efforts to strengthen coherence of military and civilian actions, 
Expressing appreciation for NATO's leadership and contributions of many nations to ISAF and OEF coalition.
The Security Council:

Determining that the situation in Afghanistan still constitutes a threat to international peace and security,

Decides to extend the authorization of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) for 12 months until 13 October 2011;

Authorizes ISAF participating Member States to take necessary measures to fulfil its mandate;

Recognizes the need to strengthen ISAF to meet operational requirements and calls on Member States to contribute personnel, equipment and resources;

Stresses the importance of increasing the functionality, professionalism and accountability of the Afghan security sector and encourages ISAF to train, mentor and empower Afghan national security forces;

Calls on ISAF to work in close consultation with the Afghan Government, the UN Special Representative and the OEF coalition;

Requests ISAF leadership to keep the Security Council regularly informed through quarterly reports;

Decides to remain actively seized of this matter.
